title: SSEN releases 37 new flexibility service zones across England and Scotland
lead: ​Scottish and Southern Electricity Networks (SSEN) Distribution has released its largest single offering of flexibility services zones.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Northern Powergrid to invest £234.5m in digitalisation
lead: ​Network operator Northern Powergrid is to invest £234.5 million in data and digitalisation initiatives.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: BP acquires Open Energi as it looks to optimise its low carbon portfolio
lead: BP has acquired Open Energi, with ambitions of scaling up globally and continuing to build on its commercial growth.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Reaching net zero may require 960GW of annual solar and wind additions by 2030, BNEF says
lead: Some 960GW of new solar PV and wind capacity must be deployed globally each year by 2030 to be on track to reach net zero by mid-century, according to new analysis from BloombergNEF (BNEF).
author: Jules Scully

title: Ecotricity makes £45.3m bid for Good Energy
lead: Ecotricity has made a cash offer for Good Energy, valuing the company at £45.3 million excluding the shares it already owns, or £59.6 million when included.
author: Alice Grundy

title: World’s first climate-focused non-profit accelerator Subak launched
lead: ​The world’s first climate-focused non-profit accelerator dubbed Subak has been launched in London, its founding members have said.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: REA calls for 2021 to be ‘watershed moment’ for renewables
lead: ​Without additional investment and policy support, the UK will fall short of its net zero ambition according to a new report from the Association for Renewable Energy and Clean Technology (REA).
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Potential for scaling vehicle-to-grid ‘feels imminent’ as new opportunities open up
lead: ​The introduction market-wide half hourly settlement, the opening up of the Balancing Mechanism and a significant code review being implemented from 2023 represent new opportunities vehicle-to-grid (V2G).
author: Alice Grundy

title: Tesla to open up Supercharger network to other EVs
lead: ​Tesla CEO Elon Musk has confirmed that the company's network of electric vehicle (EV) Superchargers is to open up to other EV models.
author: Alice Grundy

title: BEIS makes call for evidence on enabling long-duration energy storage
lead: ​A call for evidence on how to enable long-duration energy storage is the final document in a deluge of policy papers released by the government yesterday (20 July).
author: Alice Grundy

title: BEIS looks to enable V2X issuing call for evidence
lead: ​The Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy (BEIS) has today (June 20) issued a call for evidence to better understand the role of vehicle-to-x (V2X) technologies in the transition to net zero.
author: Alice Grundy

title: BEIS and Ofgem look to overhaul the ‘complex and fragmented’ energy code system
lead: ​A consultation has been launched on overhauling the energy code governance framework to help drive the transition to a clean energy system.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Government releases digitalisation strategy as it updates Smart Systems and Flexibility Plan
lead: The government and Ofgem have published an updated Smart Systems and Flexibility Plan alongside the UK’s first Energy Digitalisation Strategy.
author: Alice Grundy

title: New independent Future System Operator set to take over from National Grid
lead: ​An independent body will be needed to take over from National Grid to run the electricity system to avoid any perceived conflicts of interest within the industry, the government has confirmed.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: PODCAST: Amidst extreme weather events, can renewables do more?
lead: The new episode of the Solar Media Podcast, sponsored by Honeywell, is now available to stream, as we ponder whether renewables can be doing more as extreme weather events escalate.
author: Current± Staff

title: British Gas teams up with RAC to offer EV charger installation and smart tariff to leasing customers
lead: ​British Gas has teamed up with the RAC to offer electric vehicle (EV) charger installation as well as a bespoke electricity tariff to vehicle leasing customers.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Theresa May appointed as chair of Aldersgate Group as country faces ‘crucial crossroad’
lead: ​Theresa May has been appointed as chair of the sustainable business organisation, the Aldersgate Group.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Pivot Power kicks off West Midlands Energy Superhub projects with Wärtsilä partnership
lead: Pivot Power’s Energy Superhub rollout – combining battery energy storage and electric vehicle (EV) charging – is moving ahead with plans in place for two sites in the West Midlands.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Jumptech announces new collaboration with ProjectEV
lead: ​ProjectEV has become the latest company to adopt Jumptech’s platform to help ease the installation of electric vehicle (EV) chargepoints.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: SSE unveils Energy Solutions brand as it commits to 100% renewables for business customers
lead: ​All new fixed electricity contracts for SSE business customers will now include 100% renewable electricity as standard.
author: Alice Grundy
